author: VBaskin2010
title: The Wings Of Furno
review: Thoughout 2 Incredible Seasons Of The Whole Entire Hero Factory Series William "The Youngblood" Furno Earn Himself It's Title But Now He's Got A New Look, A New Body, A New Power, A New Hero Core, A New Helmet, A New Attitude, And A New Nickname, Cause From Now You May Called Him William "The Firebird" Furno Because Now He's Got The Spirit Of The Legendary Fighting Bird Himself, The Hawk I Just Hope He Got What It Takes To Stop Witch Doctor Once And For All.

author: KodakKid365
title: Furno can fly! With sideways wings?
review: First of all, as the title says, how can he fly with wings on his side? That makes no sense. Buy what you can do is put them on his back, so it actually looks like wings. The box is amazing, it just looks great. The plasma bow is very cool. He would be a truly legendary set, if it weren't for the lack of armor. The top part of his legs are uncovered, and his arms hardly have any as well. He needs some more size 3s for armor. The lack of armor makes him look more of a bird of prey, though a hawk or an eagle are not prey, but very dangerous predators. I don't recommend this set to anybody, unless they use lego Pick a Brick Wall, and can get some extra parts for him.

author: gnat2u
title: BEST LEGO SET EVER!!
review:
I got Furno 3.0 today and it is AWESOME!

pros

transparent green eagle nametag

plasma bow that can clip onto arms (with a little adjustment) and be dual armblades

two wings that you can also use as swords

yellow hero core

awesome eagle hemlet

really good flexibility

you can mix him up in a whole bunch of different ways

cons

head can only tilt a little bit with helmet( without the helmet it can tilt fine)

upper legs dont have armor

wings cant go into hands

wings hinder flexibility (but only a little bit)

summary

 I would totally get this set. if you happen to swing by TARGET or something and you have eight bucks, this would be the best to get.

author: Peteyking64
title: Not Bad at all
review: I might of had 1 Hero Factory robot and not a big fan of Hero Factory,but out of all I wouldn't say this is the best set of hero factory but I would say this is the best series of Hero Factory.Plus Furno is one of my favorite characters of Hero Factory along with Surge,Stormer,Bulk,and Evo.I do like animals like some of the animal powered hero's.And when I'm saying all of that I just mean Furno is my favorite 3.0 Hero Factory hero.Plus I love the parts like the hero core,the armor,the hawk headgear (a.k.a hh),the head,Almost every thing!And thanks for reading my review!Please check out my bricklists,my other reviews,my collection,sets I want,anything!Bye!

author: BulkFan98
title: Furno's Best Upgrade
review:
I was at first looking in WalMart for Bulk 3.0, and couldn't find it. My mom saw this little guy and reccommended it. I bought it along with the Jay ZX booster pack (Wished it had a spinner) and a minifigure (turned out it was the Cavewoman). I'm glad I did.

On to the pros and cons!

 

Pros:

Easy build.

Good color scheme.

Nice helmet.

Great weapon (doubles as daggars).

Eagle badge.

You can really make some epic MOCs with only a few pieces.

You can make some neat refitting stop-motions with the underaromor, chestplate, and Hero Core.

 

Cons:

Hands look a bit strange from the top.

A cavity from the back (another red foot can get rid of that).

 

 

Overall, a nice set.

 

P.S. For those of you who wonder, I'm still looking for Bulk.

author: Furno9002
title: A great 3.0 set
review:
When I first looked at this set I was like Psshh whatever and then when I was done building it It was the opposite although he has the least pieces I think he may be the best , it kinda annoyed me that his wing made it harder to move his limb which minused the playability well on to the pros and cons

 

Pros:

cool green piece

nice canistar (I use it as a hero pod )

helmet

wings

 

Cons:

kinda on the small side if you ask me

 

anyways I think this was worth the build bet a little to simple

author: Ultraace1022
title: not a very good buy. alone.
review:
building: the building is like any other of the new hero factory, and not a very challenging build

parts: it does not come with super nice pieces, but they're okay if you just need to complete the series, or if you need some more pieces.

playability: is high, as the have more joints and flexibility

value for money: i think this set is a little to much for a set that has so little

set: there is not much armor, so he is not well protected, and you can't do much with his pieces alone, but some of them are very useful, as i use the helmet and head all the time, and the blades are very useful also

overall, this set is an okay buy, but if you get another hero or villain with him, there are alot of possibilities

author: legolover2001
title: Eagle Furno
review:
This is my first Hero Factory, and wow is it good!

The design is supposed to make Furno look like an eagle but the helmet is the only eagle like bit really. 

Pros

  • Nice helmet.
  • Double dagger thing is pretty awesome.
  • Armour is good.

Cons

  • Helmet makes the head pretty much unable to move.
  • Wing/Blades can get in the way.
  • Not enough armour on arms and legs.
  • Build is boring.

Overall if you are looking for a challenging build like in some of the Hero Factory's cousins Bionicle then don't expect it but if you are looking for a nice playable or cool displayable figure then this is the one!
